newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Ciba sees EU okay for Bt maize this year.
newsitem.headline: Ciba sees EU okay for Bt maize this year.

text.p: Ciba-Geigy AG expects European Union approval by the end of this year for its genetically modified maize, according to a spokesman for the Swiss pharmaceutical group.
"We believe that Bt maize will be approved for use in the European Union and that a decision will be made this year despite the delay," Arthur Einsele told reporters.
Einsele is the designated spokesman for the agricultural seeds division of Novartis, the pharmaceutical giant that will emerge from a planned merger of Ciba and Swiss rival Sandoz AG.
Einsele was referring to a delay in the EU decision announced on Monday, when European Farm Commissioner Franz Fischler said the European Commission would not take a decision before December.
Fischler said new scientific questions had come up which were important for assessing the safety of the maize, which has been genetically modified to resist the European corn borer pest.
Ciba's maize has already been approved for release by U.S. authorities and the company is also seeking approval in Switzerland.
